4iRClvmRfF2zlVPN.description: The alicorn Flies and Strikes twice with their wings at any points during their movement. Each attack counts toward the alicorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after they make all the attacks.
4iRClvmRfF2zlVPN.name: Aerial Attack

V4lzL2hQ8JPSZS3q.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the alicorn Casts a Spell

Effect The alicorn attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). If successful, the alicorn can choose to gain the effects of the triggering spell as its sole target.
V4lzL2hQ8JPSZS3q.name: Draw in Magic

XCw63niaQc8PpjeX.description: The alicorn harnesses a powerful burning ray of light from their horn. Creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:120] take @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save). An unholy creature in the area takes an additional @Damage[8d6[spirit]] damage. If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, the beam attempts to counteract the darkness (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). The alicorn can't use its Beam of Light again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge its Beam of Light]]{1d4 rounds}.
XCw63niaQc8PpjeX.name: Beam of Light

aGDOPFkZvQXyKHde.description: An alicorn's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.
aGDOPFkZvQXyKHde.name: Ghost Touch

jv8ovLJKE1yASdO6.description: The alicorn has an empathic connection to the creatures of the natural world that. The alicorn can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on animals and to make very simple Requests of them.
jv8ovLJKE1yASdO6.name: Wild Empathy

Almiraj.description:
An almiraj closely resembles a yellow hare in almost all ways... except for the 2-foot-long black horn jutting from its forehead. Though it shares this trait with the docile unicorn, that's where their similarities end. Almirajes are vicious creatures, known to slaughter much larger cattle and, in times of desperation, people. Its stare is said to send even the bravest warrior running for their life.

Unlike common hares, almirajes are solitary and intensely territorial. They're adaptable ambush hunters with the stamina and speed to chase down any prey. They attack with their jaws and claws but are primarily known for trying to gut their prey with a vicious stab from their horn. Many scholars believe that the terrifying magical aura the creatures exude originates from their horns. This line of thinking has led to an increase in almiraj attacks as local citizens try to capture the creature alive and remove the horn, hoping this will turn it into a more docile hare. These hopes have not proven fruitful, as an almiraj is just as aggressive, if not more so, after their horn has been removed.

Adventurers often think themselves lucky if they manage to avoid the terrifying horn of this ferocious predator, but it's a much better alternative than being caught in its jaws. Almirajes have a nasty habit of grabbing their prey and vigorously shaking them until they go limp. If this fails, they'll drag their prey underground until they suffocate deep in the earth. Few have ever escaped the burrow of an almiraj.

Yllc8kTuEZymMZNX.description:
5 feet @Check[type:will|dc:22]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence] Creatures that critically fail are also fleeing for 1 round.

erq7htTm9cchOw4q.description:
Requirements The almiraj has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The almiraj attempts to flee with its meal, burrowing into the ground. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20] save or be dragged beneath the ground as the almiraj Burrows up to its Speed. If the target succeeds at its save, it Escapes and the almiraj continues burrowing as normal; if it fails, the grabbed creature must hold its breath or begin suffocating under the dirt.
erq7htTm9cchOw4q.name: Into the Earth

glOxKwPlPrPkwFQq.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Fleeing creatures take an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
glOxKwPlPrPkwFQq.name: Reactive Strike (Horn only)

pjdVf0QiDu8QNlCa.description: The almiraj lowers its head and moves with ferocity toward its selected prey. The almiraj Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, it makes a horn Strike against that enemy. This Strike deals an additional @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.
pjdVf0QiDu8QNlCa.name: Goring Charge

wxslfNkCD8uhnRZR.description:
Requirements The almiraj has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The almiraj clamps its jaws down on the creature and shakes it vigorously, attempting to finish it off. The creature takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. Small or smaller creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to their save.
wxslfNkCD8uhnRZR.name: Final Shake

Almiraj.name: Almiraj

Apothecary Bee.description:
These giant bees feed on the nectar of medicinal herbs and magical flowers, naturally processing the liquid into syrupy-sweet potions. Depending on the precise diet of the apothecary bees, they can produce a wide variety of potions, storing any excess in the waxy cells lining their nest. Apothecary bee workers are about a foot long, with yellow and black stripes. While carrying a potion, the bee's abdomen visibly swells and often changes color to match the potion within.

The value of the apothecary bees' potions has led to numerous attempts at domestication, a dangerous, expensive dream with both high risks and high rewards. Once a magical garden has been established, apothecary beehives tend to become self-sustaining. Beekeepers can potentially guide their cultivation, but they're no longer necessary for the hive's survival. Some ancient, long-abandoned gardens still grow along the Sphinx River in Osirion, where many apothecary bees prowl for flowers that meet their standards. Upon their most recent dig to the surface, surki communities quickly began the process of "trading" with the bees, establishing habitats and using their natural magic sense to better tend the massive fields a large hive needs. Miflits, on the other hand, often end up absorbed into the bees' social structure.

The potions a hive produces vary from season to season, depending on what flowers are available. Beekeepers have made strides in creating gardens that yield specific potions and have even developed harvesting techniques that increase potion effectiveness. These techniques are valuable, closely guarded secrets, but even defective potions with cursed results have found use among the followers of Calistria and Norgorber.

1Xy7RCo9U1pE8GLk.description: With an appropriate diet, an apothecary bee will create a potion of 6th level or lower every two weeks. Most often, this is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}. Each apothecary bee can store only one completed potion at a time. Unused potions can generally be harvested from an apothecary bee with a successful @Check[nature|dc:23] or @Check[survival|dc:23] check.
1Xy7RCo9U1pE8GLk.name: Internal Cauldron

HiQNiL6IgNMdZtnM.description: Apothecary bees' complex eyes let them see the auras of magical potions and instinctively identify potions of their level or lower. These auras are visible through mundane containers, though their eyes have no special ability to perceive or identify non-magical solutions, such as alchemical elixirs.
HiQNiL6IgNMdZtnM.name: Potionsight

Ux7MkNJ0woR1eBb6.description: The apothecary bee consumes the potion it has stored in its body. If the potion has the healing trait, the apothecary bee heals for the maximum amount.
Ux7MkNJ0woR1eBb6.name: Ingest Potion

VgW9B7ssvo9NV1DJ.description: The apothecary bee injects its stored potion into a willing creature within its reach. This deals @Damage[1[piercing]] damage and grants the recipient the normal effects of drinking the potion.
VgW9B7ssvo9NV1DJ.name: Inject Potion

njwjHnMHM7JotGBs.description:
Requirements The apothecary bee has no stored potions

Effect The apothecary bee slurps up a potion within its reach, storing it internally. A creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:25] save to protect a potion in its possession.
njwjHnMHM7JotGBs.name: Drain Potion

Apothecary Bee.name: Apothecary Bee

17n9uAXARDmFSevf.description: An ascendant griffon can Fly at full speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons, moving that creature along with it.
17n9uAXARDmFSevf.name: Carry Off

43omV52GL7Hlo6rl.description:
Requirements The ascendant griffon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons;

Effect The griffon makes a beak Strike to rip at the flesh of its prey. If the Strike hits, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4).
43omV52GL7Hlo6rl.name: Disembowel

ETE17tmPQayEs1cw.description: The ascendant griffon glides violently forward, Flying twice. It makes a wing Strike at any point during the movement against up to two different targets; if either of these attacks is a critical hit, the target also takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.
ETE17tmPQayEs1cw.name: Razor-Edged Flight

bAoiJ2oxvkDfrngf.description:
The ascendant griffon unleashes a fearsome cry that strikes terror into its prey. Each creature within 100 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.
bAoiJ2oxvkDfrngf.name: Terrifying Screech

e1Z1NtjcYsw6wjsJ.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within 30 feet of the ascendant griffon

Effect The ascendant griffon turns its head to stare down the triggering creature, and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} it. This use of Demoralize has the visual trait rather than the auditory trait, and the griffon does not take a penalty on its check for not sharing a language.
e1Z1NtjcYsw6wjsJ.name: Dread Gaze

RiXZj6oaa9kK9Som.description: A barded manticore's unarmed attacks (including spikes) count as adamantine, cold iron, dawnsilver, and silver.
RiXZj6oaa9kK9Som.name: Metallic Coating

ozg3kPXCLDVX4iV0.description:
Trigger An opponent casts a spell that targets the manticore and requires a saving throw

Effect The manticore gains a +4 circumstance bonus to the saving throw. If they critically succeed at the save, they can choose a creature within 30 feet that was not originally targeted by the spell. That creature becomes a new target of the spell, who must attempt its own save against the same DC.
ozg3kPXCLDVX4iV0.name: Spell Reflection

qxNa3P8uZnbHTER0.description: The barded manticore flexes the muscles under their scales to temporarily gain better protection. The manticore gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and resistance 15 to their choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. These benefits last until the beginning of the manticore's next turn or they use Arrange Scales again.
qxNa3P8uZnbHTER0.name: Arrange Scales

xOH25nEGFaWkOOeo.description: The barded manticore flings two spikes from their tail, targeting up to two creatures within 20 feet of each other. They make a separate ranged Strike against each creature, which counts as a single Strike for the barded manticore's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until they've made both Strikes. If the manticore targeted only one creature and hits, that creature takes normal damage for a single spike, but also gains weakness 15 to electricity damage until the spikes are removed with an Interact action.
xOH25nEGFaWkOOeo.name: Paired Spikes

Blooming Guardian.description: The pestilent blossoms adorning the antlers of a blooming guardian are most beautiful in moonlight, when they achieve full bloom and reveal their celestial glow. When blooming guardians near the end of their life cycle, they walk one final patrol of their forest as their ancient body decomposes into the understory.

H7IQtJQD9FmQfOV2.description: The blooming guardian can dissipate momentarily into a swirling cloud of petals and pollen to pass over brambles and slip through cracks. When Striding in woodland terrain, the blooming guardian ignores difficult terrain and can pass through obstacles so long as there is a small passageway.
H7IQtJQD9FmQfOV2.name: Petal Form

SFUExku7yyhLDUFH.description:
Requirements The blooming guardian is in Full Bloom

Effect The blooming guardian confronts their mortality, causing their flowers to burst and spray their pollen. All creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] take @Damage[10d10[void]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save. The blooming guardian then exits Full Bloom and can't enter it again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Full Bloom]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7] lose that condition and increase the drained condition by the same value.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage.
SFUExku7yyhLDUFH.name: Wail of the Forest

TJzgGeRCww5GyIC9.description: 20 feet. A blooming guardian is in a constant state of decomposition; to keep this entropy at bay, the flowers that cover their antlers continually siphon life from the surrounding area. All living creatures that enter or start their turn in the emanation take @Damage[6d4[void]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save). At the start of their turn in any round that the blooming guardian deals damage with siphoning buds, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, plus 2 temporary Hit Points for each creature damaged beyond the first since the blooming guardian's last turn, to a maximum of 20 temporary Hit Points.
TJzgGeRCww5GyIC9.name: Budding Siphon

Wmct8iyApUEKtHqw.description: The flowers on the blooming guardian's antlers bloom, unveiling their brilliance as they eat away at their host. While in this stance, the blooming guardian's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage plus @Damage[5[persistent,poison]] damage; on a hit, a target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. The blooming guardian takes @Damage[5[persistent,poison]] damage as long as it's in Full Bloom.
Wmct8iyApUEKtHqw.name: Full Bloom

XsYwIC33w2sSqec4.description: The blooming guardian Strides twice and makes an antlers Strike after either Stride. If the Strike hits, the blooming guardian deals an extra @Damage[2d12[bludgeoning]] damage, and the target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its next Fortitude save against blossom siphon.
XsYwIC33w2sSqec4.name: Goring Charge

Blooming Guardian.name: Blooming Guardian

Carnotaurus.description: This 2,000-pound predator lives up to its name by ramming its prey with its distinctive horns lowered, knocking them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and viciously tearing into fallen victims before they can regain their footing. Do not let its size fool you; this massive dinosaur is deceptively quick when charging a potential meal. Aggressive and highly territorial, a carnotaurus will not hesitate to hunt down and slay any creature unlucky enough to cross its path.

9Og1kqVtRbdxL6em.description: The carnotaurus's jaws Strike deals an additional @Damage[1d8[bleed]] damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets.
9Og1kqVtRbdxL6em.name: Vicious Mauling

AVbQqFfDXCKjCT1Q.description: The carnotaurus lowers its horns and surges toward a foe. It Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to @Damage[(2d12+9)[piercing]] and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if successful.
AVbQqFfDXCKjCT1Q.name: Powerful Charge

S8ImYw2K1hGiXLRr.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within reach of the carnotaurus's horn Strike

Effect The carnotaurus makes a horn Strike against the triggering creature.
S8ImYw2K1hGiXLRr.name: Headbutt

Carnotaurus.name: Carnotaurus

Chaos Falcon.description:
The extreme weather that gives birth to chaos falcons grants them a mix of abilities not found in other elemental birds. To them, lightning is as natural as fire and heat as comfortable as cold. The variability of their attacks makes them dangerous, even for the well prepared.

Like their elemental cousins, chaos falcons are often the harbingers of storms. They’re also seen as omens of volcanic activity, as they will travel across great distances to play and dance in the resulting eruption. Between this association and their tendency to rain both fire and ice, their presence is considered dangerous by nearby settlements.

Fortunately, chaos falcons are solitary birds that prefer to stay away from the noise of civilization. They nest in volcanic vents or areas with geothermal activity, relying on the heat of the earth to incubate their eggs while hunting in the wilderness nearby. Unless their peace is disrupted or their safety threatened, they’re unlikely to attack creatures that move through their habitat.

KNTmNvXUd4b54Ezg.description: Water condenses around the ash particles in the chaos falcon's 15-foot aura, pelting everything beneath it with driving rain. Creatures in that area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save or be pushed 20 feet down, falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if they start or end this movement on the ground.
KNTmNvXUd4b54Ezg.name: Flash Storm

q7YzgrwG28M1FPS5.description:
Requirements The chaos falcon is Flying

Effect The chaos falcon Flies twice straight down. If they reach the ground or a similarly solid object at the end of this movement, their landing shatters that surface into sharp shards and droplets of molten stone deal @Damage[4d6[fire]] and @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save) to all other creatures within 20 feet.
q7YzgrwG28M1FPS5.name: Dive-bomb

r4bPsbpazbrt1Ign.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair a chaos falcon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.
r4bPsbpazbrt1Ign.name: Stormsight

u06jlFoOhZZGOwBk.description: The chaos falcon's bolt Strike always deals the damage type of their storm nexus aura.
u06jlFoOhZZGOwBk.name: Storm Bolt

xb2XYGog1r8YfKUi.description: 15 feet, @Damage[3d6[fire]], @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save. The chaos falcon is surrounded by a cloud of volcanic ash, lightning arcing within the cloud as it glows hot in some areas and collects ice in others. A chaos falcon can change the damage type of this aura to @Damage[3d6[cold]], @Damage[3d6[electricity]], or @Damage[3d6[fire]] as an action, which has the concentrate trait.
xb2XYGog1r8YfKUi.name: Storm Nexus

Chaos Falcon.name: Chaos Falcon

Concert Frog.description: These massive frogs store their eggs inside their stomach. When an egg hatches, the froglet crawls its way up into its parent’s mouth to add its celebratory chirps and croaks to the family’s song.

8t5Ell1WdxVDU0DO.description:
One of the froglets begins to sing, granting one of three effects to the concert frog and all allies within 60 feet until the beginning of the concert frog's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.I4C55X7AzchlF9FM]{Effect: Conduct}

  • Red Grants a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.
  • Blue Grants a +1 status bonus to AC and Fortitude saving throws.
  • Yellow Allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional @Damage[1d4[sonic]] damage on successful melee Strikes as their attacks resonate.
8t5Ell1WdxVDU0DO.name: Conduct

vVWCORwSeynpO42i.description: The concert frog has three froglets perched behind its lips, each of a different color. A creature can specifically target a froglet. If any froglets have died, the concert frog attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] at the end of its turn; on a success, new froglets hatch in its stomach and emerge at the concert frog's lips.
vVWCORwSeynpO42i.name: Three-Frog Orchestra

Concert Frog.name: Concert Frog

Crying Cicada.description:
These small insects are a nuisance and danger to small villages within Brevoy, taking over entire forests and blending in with the foliage. Also known as calling beetles, due to their ability to mimic and repeat the voices of their previous victims, crying cicadas wait for passersby to lure into the trees, fascinating their victims with their cries before fluttering their wings to release toxic dust. Once a target is near death, crying cicadas will take flight from the trees and land on the body to feed.

The scale dust of crying cicadas can be turned into an effective ingested poison, but obtaining a cicada and harvesting these scales is so dangerous that most would-be poisoners simply die in the process. Even finding the insects is dangerous enough; crying cicadas' natural stealth and dark coloration make them difficult to locate among the trees of a forest, and following their cries often leads one to fall victim to the very creatures they're hunting.

The longer a colony of crying cicadas stays in a forest, the wider their collection of cries grows. Often, a young colony will be able to replicate only the sounds of small, dying creatures, but larger, more established colonies will have the ability to mimic the sounds of children and dragons.

Iv7FApuZwIfSDKZ6.description: The crying cicada beats its wings together, exposing all creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] to crying cicada poison.
Iv7FApuZwIfSDKZ6.name: Wing Flurry

Wl43DGa4w9p8kiCY.description:
The crying cicada mimics the noise of a wounded animal or crying child. Non-cicada creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:150] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save or be distressed by the pleas for help. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the cicada uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Sob, that creature is temporarily immune to Sob for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature believes an animal or child needs help somewhere nearby. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or move closer to the cicada as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the cicada, it stays still and doesn't act.
Wl43DGa4w9p8kiCY.name: Sob

YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus slowed 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round).
YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.name: Crying Cicada Poison

mjky5VTu0lNXpdL8.description: When the crying cicada is still and perched on a tree, it blends seamlessly into the environment. It has an automatic result of 30 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as part of the tree.
mjky5VTu0lNXpdL8.name: Wings Flat

p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.description:
Requirements An enemy creature has spoken since the crying cicada's last turn

Effect The crying cicada learns and mimics the sound of its opponent's voice. It can't make new sentences, but it can choose to repeat select parts of the phrases it has heard. All non-cicada creatures within 30 feet, other than the owner of the stolen voice, must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save to disbelieve the mimicry.
p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.name: Steal Voice

Crying Cicada.name: Crying Cicada

Decapod Dinghy.description:
Decapod dinghies are massive crabs indigenous to the Okaiyo Ocean that often assist the local humanoids with transportation. They can understand Thalassic and are instantly recognizable by the colorful anemones they carry on their backs and in their front claws. Athamarus and merfolk are common sights atop decapod dinghies, lounging comfortably amidst the anemones and sharing food with their hosts.

This peaceful cooperation is indirectly caused by the legendary crustacean Tehialai-Thief-Of-Ships. Since Tehialai's rampages are a constant threat in the Okaiyo, the ancestors of the decapod dinghies bonded with other marine life to survive. Decapod dinghies' relationship with anemones is particularly tight, using the small creatures as poisonous extensions of their own bodies and using their response to movements in the water to compensate for the decapod dinghy's otherwise poor vision. In a region wracked by Tehialai's storms, everyone needs to band together, after all.

GAUIJvPlnsI5pN4c.description: The decapod dinghy and all their willing passengers teleport to a patch of anemones within 10 miles large enough for the decapod dinghy to stand among them. Although the decapod dinghy doesn't need to see the location, they must have been there before. All creatures transported are temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.
GAUIJvPlnsI5pN4c.name: Anemone Transport

O4muO4pMRqQNB7QE.description: A decapod dinghy can carry up to 30 Bulk of creatures or unattended items on their back, such as five Medium creatures. The anemones' gentle hold on the passengers is sufficient in most situations, but while in combat, those passengers are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if they want to take other actions while remaining on the decapod dinghy's back.
O4muO4pMRqQNB7QE.name: All Aboard

dd6MzxdoX8ORkN4U.description: The anemones on the decapod dinghy's back inflate, enveloping all passengers and giving each passenger a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of the decapod dinghy's next turn.
dd6MzxdoX8ORkN4U.name: Inflate Anemones

dpFoseZUoXpa9zMt.description: The decapod dinghy's anemones sting any number of creatures they choose among passengers and those the decapod dinghy has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The stings deal @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic]). Drthak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Drthaks are aquatic predators with long trailing fins that are rarely seen, clinging to coasts and estuaries where the high silt content makes them practically invisible to predators and prey alike. Some have been known to come inland, tracking their prey miles upriver before striking. The underwater environment alters the typical dischoran hunting behavior, with drthaks creating bubbles that implode to stun prey.

3cXBNyDdx24wUtWg.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet uses an auditory action

Effect The drthak Strides or Swims towards the creature.
3cXBNyDdx24wUtWg.name: Auditory Hunter

9dGAZ4GeQWPy0w5R.description: The drthak can hold its breath for about 2 hours.
9dGAZ4GeQWPy0w5R.name: Deep Breath

dPYjfixt9YiqsrCS.description: The morthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the morthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.
dPYjfixt9YiqsrCS.name: Sensitive Echolocation

g7fpjFdxAJa69lmZ.description: When the drthak misses a screech Strike against a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, it deals that creature @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage.

yes3Dw8znID2FuF6.description: The drthak can Swim at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, carrying the creature along with it.

Fangtooth School.name: Fangtooth School

Flynkett.description:
The piercing whistle of the flynkett can often be heard over the harsh jungle rains, shrieking dissonantly when its cries combine with others of its pack. Although generally effective as a warning to nearby predators, these sharp cries also serve as a lure for reckless alchemists eager to study the creature’s potent enzymes.

Flynketts’ name, most theorize, is a corruption of “flinging kettle” or “flying kettle.” They can’t truly fly, instead using their skin flaps to glide in a manner similar to flying squirrels. However, the primary use of their skin flaps isn’t for movement, but digestion. When it rains, flynketts roll up their loose skin, creating a crude sort of kettle in which to catch precipitation. The remarkable creatures’ acid combines with the falling water to break down wood, soil, or even rocks into a nutritional stew. Therefore, the flynkett can flourish when introduced to any environment with frequent rain, something solid to stand on, and a lack of natural predators.

Although their acid can be harvested without harming a flynkett, the creatures rarely cooperate. If disturbed, particularly in the middle of feeding, they release clouds of acidic steam. They’re also capable of spitting the fluid with deadly accuracy. Thankfully for those who run afoul of them, flynketts have no use for corpses and will generally break off pursuit when the interloper leaves their territory.

Several organizations and individual scholars have desperately sought to domesticate flynketts for use in alchemical production. To date, none of these efforts have been successful, though several abandoned labs still contain aggressive packs of flynketts who protect their new territory with ferocious tenacity.

6YnIhpOQ5MuJkq7l.description: The flynkett stretches its flaps to glide through the air. It moves 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air. The flynkett can remain in the air long as it spends at least 1 action Gliding each round and does not Kettle Up.
6YnIhpOQ5MuJkq7l.name: Glide

bTPVUFyH1OjjS4CW.description:
Requirements The flynkett is Kettled Up

Trigger The flynkett takes physical damage or is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The flynkett spills the contents of its full skin flaps, releasing its digestive juices in a cloud of acidic vapor that deals @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage to all non-flynkett creatures within 20 feet (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|basic:true] save). If the flynkett was boiling, the damage is increased to @Damage[4d8[acid]].
bTPVUFyH1OjjS4CW.name: Spill

iUhS0qcMQrvdqAug.description: The flynkett uses its skin flaps to form a crude kettle. While Kettled Up, the flynkett can't use its claw Strike or take move actions. If the flynkett has been Kettled Up for 1 minute or longer, and its kettle is full of water (usually due to the flynkett being in the rain), the flynkett's kettle begins to boil, emitting a piercing whistle that causes all creatures within 30 feet to take a –2 penalty to Perception checks to hear sources other than the flynkett; this is an auditory effect. The flynkett can stop Kettling Up as a free action.
iUhS0qcMQrvdqAug.name: Kettle Up

Flynkett.name: Flynkett

Ghost Ape.description: Ghost apes are reclusive and territorial creatures that usually reveal themselves only when their homes are threatened. Most ghost apes will first attempt to use their imposing presence and natural teleportation to frighten and confuse their foes into fleeing. Ghost apes can speak but aren’t particularly talkative, though they will, on rare occasions, treat with those who approach them with respect. Ghost apes can be powerful allies when motivated by a common cause, although they tend to be suspicious of outsiders, and their trust isn’t easily earned.

Gw0KJig6ShsLpnlP.description: The ghost ape beats their chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 30 feet must succeed a @Check[type:will|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). While a creature is frightened by this ability, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the ape. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

aiFPTTFcVillymnM.description: The ghost ape phases partially out of existence, its form blurring and becoming difficult to pinpoint. They can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. They also gain resistance 5 to physical damage. If the ghost ape takes force damage, this stance ends and they can't reenter it for [[/br 1d3 #rounds]]{1d3 rounds}.
aiFPTTFcVillymnM.name: Ghost Stance

Ghost Ape.name: Ghost Ape

Requirements The leopard seal is in water

Effect The leopard seal travels up to 40 feet, ending its movement on land. Enemies adjacent to the leopard seal when it ends its movement take 2d10 bludgeoning damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save) and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a failure.
MGMjpWoNmqWhhm8B.name: Predatory Slam

fT5rpQPJhWcOTfol.description: A leopard seal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.
fT5rpQPJhWcOTfol.name: Deep Breath

hCkw6rTwyaip2lSZ.description: A leopard seal treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).
hCkw6rTwyaip2lSZ.name: Protective Blubber

ufSDMesmDIjVUUrz.description: A leopard seal can use its whiskers to sense vibrations as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater
ufSDMesmDIjVUUrz.name: Whisker Sense

36l8JVIqqAV4edmp.description: A lightning turtle can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.
36l8JVIqqAV4edmp.name: Greater Electrolocation

48vLPMzxvUYMyMDf.description: The lightning turtle can hold its breath for 30 minutes.
48vLPMzxvUYMyMDf.name: Deep Breath

auQMbsuySkuEV640.description: The lightning turtle withdraws into its shell. This increases its AC to 36, but it can't act except to use Shell Shock or reemerge as a single action. While in its shell, the turtle's Shell Shock deals another @Damage[4d6[electricity]] damage and loses the nonlethal trait.
auQMbsuySkuEV640.name: Sparking Shell

beRBWWg6xwZiT840.description: The lightning turtle releases a pulse of low-intensity electricity from its body to promote healing. This restores @Damage[5d8[healing]] Hit Points to the turtle and each living ally within 10 feet, including creatures normally immune to electricity. The turtle can't use Healing Pulse again for 1 minute and is temporarily immune to the Healing Pulse of any lightning turtle for 1 minute.
beRBWWg6xwZiT840.name: Healing Pulse

yNQF1eVE0WPEHDOz.description:
Trigger A lightning turtle is hit by a melee or an unarmed attack

Effect The lightning turtle releases some of its stored electrical power, inflicting @Damage[7d6[electricity]] damage to the creature attacking it.
yNQF1eVE0WPEHDOz.name: Shell Shock

CJ589AJOrRrFopWl.description: The magnegor inadvertently digs a 10-foot-deep continuous trench in any square it Wallows through, as long as the ground in that space isn't made of stone, rock, or some other surface too hard to excavate. The trench is greater difficult terrain. At the GM's discretion, any excavated square can reveal a deposit of sedimentary rock filled with metal ore that has Hardness 7 and 28 Hit Points.
CJ589AJOrRrFopWl.name: Excavating Spines

SUcXTG82pMmewpem.description: When a magnegor takes damage from a metal weapon or an effect with the metal trait, it takes 5 additional damage and must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The value of the sickened condition increases each time the magnegor fails such a check, to a maximum of 3.
SUcXTG82pMmewpem.name: Metal Allergy

umjew4vPAU8Ye3xs.description: Magnetized Coat When a magnegor comes within 30 feet of a metal object or a deposit of metal ore, its thousands of wiry hairs stand on end, pointing towards the metal and creating a magnetic field. Metal items of light or negligible Bulk that touch the magnegor's coat adhere to it magnetically, requiring an Interact action to be pried free. Creatures wearing or primarily composed of metal treat all squares in a 10-foot radius around the magnegor as difficult terrain, unless they are moving directly towards it.
umjew4vPAU8Ye3xs.name: Magnetized Coat

xsHOUZyFnSvFmKSt.description:
Requirements The magnegor is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The magnegor rolls on its spinecovered back, up to its Speed, furrowing the earth and crushing any Large or smaller creatures in its path. This deals @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true] save; on a failed save, a creature wearing metal armor or made of metal is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the magnegor's magnetized coat (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 24). For each metal object or piece of equipment a restrained creature chooses to leave stuck to the magnegor, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attempts to Escape. A creature that relinquishes all its metal Escapes automatically. The magnegor can move at its full Speed while it has a creature restrained in this way, bringing the creature along.
xsHOUZyFnSvFmKSt.name: Wallow

ARdeJ0ZKxKc9rJd9.description: A magnetic gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a gecko attempts an Athletics check to Climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.
ARdeJ0ZKxKc9rJd9.name: Uncanny Climber

BXVPBRJja0TAlcDE.description: The gecko repulses the metal attached to its body in all directions, dealing @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save) to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]. The gecko can't use Launch Metal again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Launch Metal]]{1d4 rounds}.
BXVPBRJja0TAlcDE.name: Launch Metal

WucKQghGz6D3Wla0.description: A magnetic gecko can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.
WucKQghGz6D3Wla0.name: Greater Electrolocation

fUa7SCJuCTMftahm.description: The gecko manipulates its magnetic field to repel metal, humming audibly and gaining resistance 2 to damage from metal weapons and metal effects until the beginning of its next turn.
fUa7SCJuCTMftahm.name: Repel

vcaQ5lJKm6s0xHQG.description: If the gecko hits Small or smaller creature with its tongue, and the target is made of metal or is wearing metallic armor, the gecko's tongue latches on to the creature. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. While the gecko is Grabbing a creature in this way, it can attempt an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC to pull the creature to a space adjacent to the gecko. A creature grabbed in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally.
vcaQ5lJKm6s0xHQG.name: Static Cling

Majungasaurus.description: The majungasaurus prowls in a crouched posture, carrying its bulk so low to the ground it is eye-to-eye with its prey. Unlike most carnivorous dinosaurs, the majungasaurus is primarily an ambush predator, patiently lying in wait for quarry to come within reach before bursting from cover with a signature cry to attack.

19Hk9yB4fksq7w1P.description: When the majungasaurus rolls initiative using Stealth, it can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each creature within 30 feet as a free action. Regardless of the effect, each creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.
19Hk9yB4fksq7w1P.name: Startling Roar

saTF5z3Vo6RIF4hX.description:
Requirements The majungasaurus has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws;

Effect The majungasaurus deals that creature @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save). A creature that fails this save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until it recovers to full Hit Points.
saTF5z3Vo6RIF4hX.name: Crack Bones

Majungasaurus.name: Majungasaurus

5g4IJLaMtEhPW6ra.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star falls below half its total Hit Points

Effect The mammoth land star severs one of its own limbs as a distraction, then Strides three times. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
5g4IJLaMtEhPW6ra.name: Detach

9WlgMEC7dF3Vx1de.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26];

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 1d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}

Stage 2 2d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}

Stage 3 2d8 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}
9WlgMEC7dF3Vx1de.name: Spiny Venom

CD5zD0yBK4gwgKyE.description: The land star blows air through its feet to hover 1 foot in the air and Strides twice with a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring uneven ground and difficult terrain below it.
CD5zD0yBK4gwgKyE.name: Glide

PcbvgtJAmPJMUMi0.description: Whenever a limb is severed, it must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5]. On a success, the limb will slowly begin to grow into a new mammoth land star over the course of a week, unless it is doused in acid or fire.
PcbvgtJAmPJMUMi0.name: Regrowth

fTN4TsTSO1TZ0TDT.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star has a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed};

Effect The mammoth land star extrudes its stomach onto its prey and digests it alive. The target takes @Damage[(2d12+6)[acid]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.
fTN4TsTSO1TZ0TDT.name: Digest

oFNlkxcxCkaV0ITr.name: Regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb)

qBZJ1ZbM6jBcfV4L.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star has a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} that is wearing armor

Effect The mammoth land star makes a feet Strike against a creature it has grabbed. If that Strike hits and the creature is wearing armor with Hardness 12 or lower, the armor is broken. This Strike doesn't further damage armor that's already broken.
qBZJ1ZbM6jBcfV4L.name: Pry

su08qYwM1EZB8BNV.description: A healthy mammoth land star typically has five limbs. A creature can sever a limb by targeting it and dealing damage equal to the limb's Hit Points. The mammoth land star can regrow a missing limb over the course of 24 hours.
su08qYwM1EZB8BNV.name: Limb Regrowth

Mammoth Land Star.name: Mammoth Land Star
Mammoth Land Star.npcHp: regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb); limb regrowth

15reG9cAlQog2pqZ.description:
Trigger The marp takes damage from a melee Strike

Effect The marp drops any items held in their hands, then Climbs or Strides up to 15 feet.
15reG9cAlQog2pqZ.name: Panicked Withdrawal

IWCIzZCmumm2sZDx.description: Marps can sense any accumulation of gold within range. They also can precisely measure the purity of gold by touch.
IWCIzZCmumm2sZDx.name: Goldsense

cJWmuj6LPrdNdwqH.description:
The marp asks for gold from all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Each target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save or retrieve and drop gold valuables as a free action.

Critical Success The target can refuse the request, though they can also choose to willingly hand over any amount of gold. If they do so, they gain a +1 status bonus to the next saving throw they attempt within 1 minute, and they're temporarily immune to Scampering Theft for 1 minute.

Success The target can refuse the request.

Failure The target must drop coins, gold jewelry, or other objects worth 20 gp.

Critical Failure As failure, but 40 gp.
cJWmuj6LPrdNdwqH.name: Gold?

cLIy3Rb3RWeVSc8s.description:
The marp runs and attempts to snatch a purse, pendant, or other such object. The marp Strides up to their Speed, and they can move through enemy spaces during this movement. They then attempt to steal valuables from the target, who must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22] save.

Success The marp fails to steal anything from the target.

Failure The marp steals one object from the target's possession that is made of or contains gold. They can't steal objects held by or permanently attached to the creature. If the object contains lead, the marp drops it at the target's feet. After stealing the object (or dropping it), the marp then Strides up to their Speed.
cLIy3Rb3RWeVSc8s.name: Scampering Theft

0zQsy5U0xencZHog.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the mirror wolf's visages damages mirror wolf's ally

Effect The mirror wolf teleports to the visage's spot, destroying the visage, and makes a jaws Strike.
0zQsy5U0xencZHog.name: Visage Strike

BQQ9CDsX6RwM2t04.description: The mirror wolf attacks with such speed it leaves a visage of itself behind. When the mirror wolf Strikes, they leave behind a visage in an adjacent square. The visage is treated as an ally for effects such as flanking and pack attack. A visage has AC 10 and 1 HP and lasts for 1 round.
BQQ9CDsX6RwM2t04.name: Lingering Assailant

WCkpAIbTRQdeSQzf.description:
Requirements The mirror wolf is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The mirror wolf makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.
WCkpAIbTRQdeSQzf.name: Bonded Strike

aKe1HEWVaLLqphsT.description: The mirror wolf's Strikes deal 1d8 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the mirror wolf's allies.
aKe1HEWVaLLqphsT.name: Pack Attack

cjK0ZNEaC96yw0EV.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 14, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.
cjK0ZNEaC96yw0EV.name: Bond with Mortal

lsx9VIlR2bllPQ7r.description: The mirror wolf makes a jaws Strike against a creature within range. The mirror wolf can then Stride and make a second jaws Strike against the same creature.
lsx9VIlR2bllPQ7r.name: Strafing Strike

Mist Bear.description:
Like the mundane bears they resemble, a mist bear is motivated by simple pursuits, such as food. Unlike other ursines, the mist bear can dissipate into a cloud of ethereal vapor, greatly complicating the efforts of neighboring humanoids to keep their provisions safe from the creature’s depredations.

Fortunately, the mist bear follows a predictable pattern of behavior, usually foraging within the Universe for only a few months every year to gorge itself. Once sated, it then enters a state similar to hibernation where it drifts through the Ethereal Plane as a cloud of intangible vapor.

1rzp0hsF26PBfH7z.description:
Requirements The mist bear has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mist bear digs its claws into the grabbed creature as it dissipates into mist. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[3d8[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save). The mist bear gains the benefits of its Mist Form, Flies up to 10 feet, and then returns to its solid form.
1rzp0hsF26PBfH7z.name: Misty Mauling

9voCXlCcCWEyNhTI.description: The mist bear Strides twice. During this movement, wisps of ethereal smoke trail from its body, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. The mist bear then Strikes. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack if the bear moved at least 20 feet.
9voCXlCcCWEyNhTI.name: Clouded Charge

nxY3HK4bvu3FTNg0.description: Over the course of a minute, a mist bear can transmute its form into a cloud of ethereal vapor. In this state it has resistance 10 to physical damage, is immune to precision damage, and can't use any actions with the attack or manipulate trait. It has a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The mist bear can return to solid form as a single action.
nxY3HK4bvu3FTNg0.name: Mist Form

Mist Bear.name: Mist Bear

39iIvNupxbnuXPcd.description:
Trigger A creature the mjolgat can see targets the mjolgat with an attack

Effect The mjolgat swings its crest in the direction of the danger, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
39iIvNupxbnuXPcd.name: Head On

VQfnnoTH9xAGAEhP.description: A mjolgat can detect the ores of unrefined precious metals with its powerful nose. Common earth and stone do not impede the mjolgat from smelling ores deep within the ground.
VQfnnoTH9xAGAEhP.name: Orescent

W1s77i863STIJgAY.description: The mjolgat rears upon its hind leg to crush an enemy with its jagged crest of bone. The mjolgat makes a bone crest Strike; on a hit, the mjolgat deals an extra die of damage. This counts as two attacks when calculating the mjolgat's multiple attack penalty
W1s77i863STIJgAY.name: Hammerhead

dG1p2ew8Lk4jKSYy.description: When the mjolgat deals damage to an object (such as a shield or an ore deposit), it deals double damage.
dG1p2ew8Lk4jKSYy.name: Rockbreaker

sw6WqmhgyEp1Q7a3.description: If the mjolgat critically fails a bone crest Strike, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.
sw6WqmhgyEp1Q7a3.name: Punch-Drunk

wgonJnufyL1Z1kXj.description:
The mjolgat lets out a terrifying screech before bashing its head into the ground. Creatures within 30 feet of the mjolgat must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. Regardless of the result of the save, they are then immune to Shrieking Slam.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.
wgonJnufyL1Z1kXj.name: Shrieking Slam

ElsRoCwN3MxVJRly.description: A mocking chorus ordinarily has ten heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.
ElsRoCwN3MxVJRly.name: Head Regrowth

GMRmXeCJtb4dfXpG.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.
GMRmXeCJtb4dfXpG.name: Reactive Heads

GOAuy9ijyEzooVLR.description: While unable to communicate for prolonged periods, a mocking chorus can precisely imitate a humanoid voice. If a creature speaks within audible range of the mocking chorus, the mocking chorus can speak using the creature's voice, even if it says different words than what were spoken. Creatures that hear the mocking chorus speak this way can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save to recognize the source. On a success, creatures gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against the mocking chorus' abilities for 1 minute.
GOAuy9ijyEzooVLR.name: Uncanny Mimicry

LNIDuf4K5NOmol4v.description:
The mocking chorus adopts the voices of its enemies, spreading lies and jeers among would-be allies and tearing apart trusted friends. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] of the mocking chorus must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. The mocking chorus can't use petty whispers again for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success As failure, but the creature takes half damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[12d10[mental]] damage and is confused for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[15d10[mental]] damage and is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.
LNIDuf4K5NOmol4v.name: Petty Whispers

LjUrbZvsKM9EoRtJ.description: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 × the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.
LjUrbZvsKM9EoRtJ.name: Hydra Regeneration

Morthak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Morthaks, being low, squat, and flat, resemble a crocodile rebuilt to dig like a mole. At home beneath vast meadows and plains, the only sign of their passing are the earthen mounds they leave behind when they emerge to hunt. Those who encounter them in the wild speak of the sub-aural rumble they produce as they disintegrate the earth with sonic blasts, a sound that's felt rather than heard.

HPmIXM7jcjdzcyhT.description: The morthak makes a claw Strike against a creature wearing stone or metal armor. If the Strike hits and the armor's Hardness is 12 or lower, that armor is broken.
HPmIXM7jcjdzcyhT.name: Shattering Scrape

VTKZhdASWtnV2Rf6.description:
Trigger A creature within the morthak's reach uses an auditory action

Effect The morthak makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.
VTKZhdASWtnV2Rf6.name: Auditory Swipe

iJajFZP5ZYRFW9er.description: The morthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the morthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.
iJajFZP5ZYRFW9er.name: Sensitive Echolocation

Morthak.name: Morthak

V6SsPWfZ04OeUEDE.description: The pale horse Flies twice and then makes a horn Strike. The pale horse can move through creatures.
V6SsPWfZ04OeUEDE.name: Spectral Charge

Xw8tomP14n2Bj8VB.description: 30 feet. A living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. A creature is temporarily immune to the aura for 1 hour if it critically succeeds.
Xw8tomP14n2Bj8VB.name: Aura of Despair

lWFPmS0H0zSECgmE.description: A pale horse can accept a corporeal rider, but such a rider is left behind if the pale horse passes through a creature or object.
lWFPmS0H0zSECgmE.name: Spectral Mount

23PrYsW8p3mhE6Uh.description: The plated python lunges to its full length, making a jaws Strike with a reach of 60 feet. If the Strike hits, its target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and pulled to an empty space adjacent to the plated python. The python can attack through any material it can burrow through, leaving a stone tunnel as normal.
23PrYsW8p3mhE6Uh.name: Towering Bite

OS8aeXhGNBCVVVQc.description:
Large, @Damage[(3d10+5)[acid]], Rupture 20

This damage ignores the hardness of petrified creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

mpJvew306eSdx2tM.description: The plated python lets its breath sink into the ground, transforming it to brittle stone within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. The stone is difficult terrain to all other creatures. Other creatures on the ground in this area when it transforms must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as the stone beneath them crumbles to rubble. A creature immobilized in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally or use three total Interact actions to dig themself free.
mpJvew306eSdx2tM.name: Crumbling Earth

qsKqIHUiHZAyoVOG.description: When a plated python burrows through ground, it petrifies and destroys the material in front of it, leaving a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake. A plated python doesn't need to Squeeze to pass through any space at least that wide.
qsKqIHUiHZAyoVOG.name: Stone Tunnel

zaf8s9pW0xZzJfak.description:
Requirements The plated python has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Trigger The plated python begins its turn

Effect The python's breath seeps into the grabbed creature. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 round and Swallowed Whole.

Critical Failure The creature is petrified permanently and Swallowed Whole.
zaf8s9pW0xZzJfak.name: Petrify Prey

2hZrkUJrzTfsUVpv.description:
Trigger A creature successfully cauterizes one of the prismhydra's stumps

Effect The unstable prismatic energies in the prismhydra's body surge forth. Each creature adjacent to the prismhydra is exposed to its chromatic explosion.
2hZrkUJrzTfsUVpv.name: Prismatic Backlash

CEXfPm5kOtVj4aSz.description:
HP(head) 36, prismatic head regrowth;

Immunities area damage;

Weaknesses slashing 15
CEXfPm5kOtVj4aSz.name: Prismhydra Heads

PjV6SBjIY1Ge7WUB.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.
PjV6SBjIY1Ge7WUB.name: Reactive Heads

TowRcjxa5ZN7kGUP.description: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 × the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.
TowRcjxa5ZN7kGUP.name: Hydra Regeneration

k08YNB4ccJD1Ohew.description: A prismhydra's heads are replete with arcane energy. Whenever the prismhydra successfully Strikes an opponent with its spittle, or when an opponent cauterizes one of the prismhydra's heads, the opponent takes @Damage[6d6[untyped]] damage of the type matching the head's vulnerability (typically acid, cold, fire, or electricity), with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save.
k08YNB4ccJD1Ohew.name: Chromatic Explosion

tHcAM0IJtyMBlTXA.description:
A prismhydra ordinarily has eight heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration.

Each head requires a different type of damage to cauterize; typically, two heads each are vulnerable to acid, cold, electricity, and fire damage, but other combinations or more exotic vulnerabilities are possible. When a prismhydra successfully regrows heads, all the heads regrown have the same vulnerability, which must be the same as the vulnerability of one of the prismhydra's unsevered heads.

If all eight heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.
tHcAM0IJtyMBlTXA.name: Prismatic Head Regrowth

Protoceratops.description: Though it lacks the distinctive horns of its larger relative the triceratops, the protoceratops is more than capable of holding its own in combat, using its tail to knock enemies to the ground and its sturdy frill to turn away blows.

BNij3WTNhwLJRILS.description:
Requirements The protoceratops is in its Defensive Posture

Trigger An adjacent ally would take damage from a physical attack;

Effect The protoceratops partially blocks the blow with its frill, reducing the damage by 5
BNij3WTNhwLJRILS.name: Frill Block

R72uRW5zGCfe84EQ.description: The protoceratops tucks in its head and presents its sturdy frill, granting a +1 circumstance bonus to AC adjacent allies. The protoceratops remains in its Defensive Posture until the start of its next turn, but only grants the bonus while allies remain adjacent
R72uRW5zGCfe84EQ.name: Defensive Posture

Protoceratops.name: Protoceratops

Rift Chameleon.description: Rift chameleons are best known for their unsettling ability to swallow creatures significantly larger than themselves, thanks to a digestive tract that connects to its own pocket of the Ethereal Plane. When two or more rift chameleons remain in proximity for extended periods of time, their partially extradimensional nature begins to subtly warp the surrounding terrain. Direction and distance become confused to all but the lizards, making it easy for locals to get lost in places they once thought familiar.

4ZR4SCFbblWF8wBu.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rift chameleon Strides twice. During this movement, it flits quickly between the Universe and the Ethereal Plane, gaining resistance 5 to physical damage.
4ZR4SCFbblWF8wBu.name: Flickering Dash

7vxFfLvgqYWDkQpU.description: A rift chameleon can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, even if it doesn't have cover, but it cannot be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the Ethereal Plane.
7vxFfLvgqYWDkQpU.name: Ethereal Camouflage

TThoeZuLbhpozxhc.description: The rift chameleon's innards exist partially on the Ethereal Plane, allowing it to swallow any number of creatures, even ones larger than itself. Creatures that @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or cut themselves free from the chameleon's stomach reappear in the Universe adjacent to the rift chameleon's position. Creatures cannot escape from the rift chameleon's gullet using teleportation effects unless those effects can also cross planar boundaries.
TThoeZuLbhpozxhc.name: Extradimensional Gullet

ib69NvASfvjsqsSg.description: Any creature hit by the rift chameleon's tongue is pulled adjacent to the chameleon. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the next Strike the rift chameleon makes against it this round.
ib69NvASfvjsqsSg.name: Tongue Pull

Rift Chameleon.name: Rift Chameleon

Royal Basilisk.description: The royal basilisk is aptly named, not for only the metal crown upon its head but also for the unique potency of its poison. The creature's poison manifests as a sort of cloying vapor that sticks onto and eats away at anything it touches. Their mastery of poison does appear to come at a cost, as the royal basilisk has no ability to petrify its prey. Although the royal basilisk can painstakingly shape a crown, some made of simple iron and others of rare skymetals, they much prefer to collect crowns crafted by other creatures.

IVRkyNW8ZnlDFKUQ.description: The royal basilisk's crown is firmly attached to its head but can be Disarmed as though it were a held item. Without a crown, the royal basilisk's mastery over poison is weakened enough that it loses its miasmatic shroud. The royal basilisk can equip a crown within its tail's reach as an Interact action. A royal basilisk's crown is normally made of iron and enables the basilisk to use miasmatic shroud, but crowns made of other, more exotic materials might confer different abilities.
IVRkyNW8ZnlDFKUQ.name: Crowned Royalty

Kzg1FKJxsglkhdRO.description:
Requirements A Large or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the royal basilisk's jaws

Effect The royal basilisk moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The royal basilisk's coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.
Kzg1FKJxsglkhdRO.name: Wrap in Coils

XNwz0M9jFNsJD6gO.description: The royal basilisk spits its poison with immense force, dealing @Damage[5d10[acid]] and @Damage[5d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save) to creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:240] and exposing each creature that took damage to royal basilisk venom. The line penetrates barriers with Hardness of less than 20, ignoring any bonuses they'd provide from cover. The royal basilisk can't use Stone-Hewing Spit again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Stone-Hewing Spit]]{1d4 rounds}.
XNwz0M9jFNsJD6gO.name: Stone-Hewing Spit

fwBO7BD8je9omBHJ.description: 15 feet. The poison in the breath of the royal basilisk makes the air around it a haze, concealing it from all creatures outside the aura, but it cannot use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. When a creature ends its turn within the aura, it is exposed to royal basilisk venom.
fwBO7BD8je9omBHJ.name: Miasmatic Shroud

uvTvb2cBy4Nv0Ggv.description:
Saving Throw DC 36

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d10[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)
uvTvb2cBy4Nv0Ggv.name: Royal Basilisk Venom

Royal Basilisk.name: Royal Basilisk

2Cv5TIKMVRX9Kkh2.description: The rumindrol attempts individual Strikes against each creature in its reach. It can attempt up to one jaws Strike and any number of leg Strikes. Each attack counts toward the rumindrol's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
2Cv5TIKMVRX9Kkh2.name: Thrash

3K6igu8m8zgxofGA.description: The rumindrol recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, slowed, and stunned conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.
3K6igu8m8zgxofGA.name: Inexorable

7KrYQNfJEo32CsPy.description:
The rumindrol focuses its sonic emanations on a creature it's aware of within the area of its enthralling call aura. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune to Entropic Cry for 1 hour.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is sickened 2, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.
7KrYQNfJEo32CsPy.name: Entropic Cry

AsHXubWWh9IZnPhY.description: 60 feet. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) and take 3d8 sonic damage.
AsHXubWWh9IZnPhY.name: Dreadful Resonance

ZJJADpm0KkKvAPWt.description:
Trigger The rumindrol Grabs a creature

Effect The rumindrol uses Swallow Whole.
ZJJADpm0KkKvAPWt.name: Fast Swallow

rtr0WHiLIFMDOLrM.description: 1 mile. Each non-rumindrol creature that enters or starts its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to this effect for 1 day (1 hour on a critical failure). Any creature fascinated in this way will attempt to find the source of the rumindrol's cry, mindlessly wandering towards it.
rtr0WHiLIFMDOLrM.name: Enthralling Call

DURQZqvnE1WhBP0b.description: The scroungefeather's nest of sharp metallic junk covers a 15-foot-by15-foot area. The area is difficult terrain and hazardous terrain to any nonscroungefeather creatures. A creature that moves on the ground through the nest takes @Damage[3[piercing]] damage for each square of the area it moves into. Scroungefeathers can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} at any point in the nest.
DURQZqvnE1WhBP0b.name: Junk Nest

Mem6QODpIHtqr1NO.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather has Grabbed Debris

Effect The scroungefeather flings the debris at a target within 20 feet, making an attack roll with a +12 modifier. On a success, the target takes @Damage[(2d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.
Mem6QODpIHtqr1NO.name: Tossed Scraps

P7J5DmONxucVFHWg.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather is in its nest or another environment rich with debris

Effect The scroungefeather uses an Interact action to grab an item with its beak, selected randomly; roll 1d4 to determine the type of debris. The scroungefeather gains access to the listed abilities until it uses Tossed Scraps to discard the debris or until it Releases the debris. The scroungefeather can't use its beak attack while it is using its beak to Grab Debris.

d4 Item Effect
1 Armor Scrap The scroungefeather gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC.
2 Shattered blade The scroungefeather gains a broken blade melee Strike with a +12 attack modifier that deals 2d10+6 slashing damage.
3 Unexploded bomb When the scroungefeather throws this with Tossed Scraps, all the damage is fire damage, and the bomb also deals 3 fire splash damage.
4 Faulty wand The scroungefeather gains a magic bolt ranged Strike witha +14 attack modifier that deals 2d6+6 force damage.
P7J5DmONxucVFHWg.name: Grab Debris

1nZ2035uetODaoFs.description: A rider who would tame a shotalashu for a mount must first form a telepathic link with it. Establishing this link require spending a week with the desired mount and succeeding at a @Check[type:occultism|dc:21] check. Any creature with telepathic capabilities, such as telepathy, touch telepathy, empathic sense, or the ability to cast spells such as telepathy, gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. This link remains and neither can form a new link until one member dies. The shock of a partner dying leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for at least a month.
1nZ2035uetODaoFs.name: Telepathic Link

82XzBMw5oI7GUeuR.description: The shotalashu ignores difficult terrain due to vegetation.
82XzBMw5oI7GUeuR.name: Jungle Stride

BetFmirFqNcNW9mI.description: While a shotalashu can't speak, even telepathically, it understands simple commands in the languages it knows. It returns telepathic sensations of emotion to creatures touching it or the partner of its telepathic link at any distance.
BetFmirFqNcNW9mI.name: Empathic Communication

niDY9lm2zgxq1GvI.description:
The shotalashu hunts by pinning its foes with its mind. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a –5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round.

Failure The creature takes a –10 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round. The shotalashu can then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for one round. The shotalashu can Leap.
niDY9lm2zgxq1GvI.name: Telepathic Pounce

0qVp9z4JPMeFgkn5.description: The sky fisher reels in a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tentacles, pulling them into an adjacent space, and then attempts to Swallow them Whole (Large, 3d8+12 acid, Rupture 25). The sky fisher can only use Swallow Whole when using Abduct.
0qVp9z4JPMeFgkn5.name: Abduct

7XedHDwtFnozsLZn.description: The sky fisher quickly expels some of its gases to move swiftly through the air, Flying up to 100 feet in a straight line; this movement doesn’t trigger reactions.
7XedHDwtFnozsLZn.name: Jet

LuwGMxjIRQTDlHoq.description: y Unless it has fed recently, the sky fisher is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. Using non-hostile actions does not cause the sky fisher to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. When it takes a hostile action of any kind, the sky fisher is hidden instead of undetected until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its many tendrils temporarily becomes faintly visible.
LuwGMxjIRQTDlHoq.name: Transparency

Xbic0yIcsOvXhcbw.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and can't speak above a whisper (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and can't speak (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)
Xbic0yIcsOvXhcbw.name: Sky Fisher Venom

dkkw8bvkw35Kan9I.description: ) The sky fisher vents flesh-eating enzymes into the air, dealing @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid]] damage and @Damage[3d6[persistent,bleed]] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save). It can't use Enzymic Vent again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
dkkw8bvkw35Kan9I.name: Enzymic Vent

Soniphak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Often mistaken for drakes, soniphaks glide above rocky or barren ground, picking out prey with their hearing. A hunting soniphak disables its targets with concentrated bursts of sound before snatching them up and feasting on the move.
