Despite being able to speak, soniphaks are no more social than other dischorans, generally responding to even the quietest attempts at communication with destructive shouting.

D6TybuaAzhYJfP2K.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the soniphak uses an auditory action

Effect The soniphak makes a screech Strike against the triggering creature. This disrupts a triggering concentrate action if the Strike is a critical hit.
D6TybuaAzhYJfP2K.name: Disruptive Screech

ELLDkkqDHf5Yl8lp.description: The soniphak can Fly at half Speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.
ELLDkkqDHf5Yl8lp.name: Snatch

F3A1wbRFUhHW7CqK.description: The morthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the morthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.
F3A1wbRFUhHW7CqK.name: Sensitive Echolocation

GBUlcSToBzMlWQnF.description: Whenever a soniphak hits with a screech Strike, feedback deals each creature the soniphak has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage.
GBUlcSToBzMlWQnF.name: Aftershock

sMs1a1cLWNZ7JWYx.description: The soniphak can focus its screech at a stone or rock surface within 60 feet to create an explosion in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] from the point of impact. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain due to fragments of loose stone.
sMs1a1cLWNZ7JWYx.name: Shattering Scream

Soniphak.name: Soniphak

Sporeback Frog.description: This burrowing frog digs itself into moist earth so poisonous moss and toxic mushrooms can grow on its body.

qIeDtpx57l5sc4q4.description: The sporeback frog shakes the plants and fungi on its back until they emit a cloud of spores in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. All creatures in the area must succeed a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure). This ability can't be used again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge be used]]{1d4 rounds}.
qIeDtpx57l5sc4q4.name: Soporific Spores

uzcy9ZSDv3LL6h9o.description: A creature hit by the sporeback frog's tongue Strike takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] damage as fungal spores begin to grow.
uzcy9ZSDv3LL6h9o.name: Seed Spores

Sporeback Frog.name: Sporeback Frog

7Zuc7c1bOXD3I5JL.description: The stargut hydra lurches its entire body, spewing forth chunks of meteorite in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] that deal @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]). The area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, though a creature can use an Interact action to clear one square of the rubble. The stargut hydra can't Vomit Meteorites for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
7Zuc7c1bOXD3I5JL.name: Vomit Meteorites

LRRRKeQoeeCxpZFC.description: The stargut hydra has regeneration equal to 3 × the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a DC 29 Fortitude save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.
LRRRKeQoeeCxpZFC.name: Hydra Regeneration

WpApOWeV9Yy8hi6U.description:
Each stargut hydra has at least one metamorphosis resulting from consuming a specific skymetal and internalizing its properties. If you give a stargut hydra more than one metamorphosis, you should consider increasing its level and changing its statistics.

Adamantine The stargut hydra's Strikes bypass Hardness and are treated as adamantine. The stargut hydra gains resistance 10 to physical damage (except adamantine).

Abysium(aura, poison) The stargut hydra emits an aura of nauseating radiation from the abysium in its body. Any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the stargut hydra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Djezet(magical) The stargut hydra gains a +2 status bonus to saves against magic.

Inubrix The stargut hydra's Strikes ignore resistance to damage from metal armor's armor specialization effects and do not trigger the Shield Block reaction or reactions from armor property runes.

Noqual The stargut hydra's Strikes and abilities gain a +2 status bonus to damage against creatures with the ability to Cast a Spell.

Orichalcum When the stargut hydra has only two heads remaining, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. It can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

Siccatite After the stargut hydra takes fire damage, it becomes superheated, gaining immunity to fire and weakness 10 to cold. While superheated, cold damage can be used to cauterize a stump. After the stargut hydra takes cold damage, it becomes chilled, gaining immunity to cold and weakness 10 to fire.
WpApOWeV9Yy8hi6U.name: Skymetal Metamorphosis

sY0gmlsyxj94fplt.description: A stargut hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.
sY0gmlsyxj94fplt.name: Reactive Heads

vFIurAInqp3GyBPZ.description: A stargut hydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.
vFIurAInqp3GyBPZ.name: Head Regrowth

Stonefish.description: Stonefish use their superior camouflage to lie in wait and devour small prey, becoming indistinguishable from the reefs they call home. Larger creatures are also at risk, although mostly through accidental contact with the stonefish’s spines and their agonizing venom.

1f2PgrJfd3BP5KWT.description: When a creature moves into a space with one or more stonefish, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish venom.
1f2PgrJfd3BP5KWT.name: Defensive Spines

NEFPwQtJW3PaG1vO.description: The stonefish can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in its natural environment even if it doesn't have cover.
NEFPwQtJW3PaG1vO.name: Camouflage

u2l5vP3881zLQeZt.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 3 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and clumsy 2 (1 hour)
u2l5vP3881zLQeZt.name: Stonefish Venom

Stonefish.name: Stonefish

Stonefish Swarm.description: Stonefish occasionally band together where food is abundant, filling all nooks and crannies of a coral reef. In large numbers, stonefish can take on prey much larger than themselves.

30Xxn6WE11NrGrqJ.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:18|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail the save are exposed to stonefish swarm venom.
30Xxn6WE11NrGrqJ.name: Inject Poison

AWlVbiAbVePA0gpF.description: When a creature moves into a space with one or more stonefish, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish venom.
AWlVbiAbVePA0gpF.name: Defensive Spines

jn9AnjvtJSsTXoFG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)
jn9AnjvtJSsTXoFG.name: Stonefish Swarm Venom

q8Xoe5BhuPRGZ9IQ.description: Until the next time it acts, the stonefish swarm appears to be a colorful coral reef. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a reef.
q8Xoe5BhuPRGZ9IQ.name: Reef Camouflage

Stonefish Swarm.name: Stonefish Swarm

bpzkvokQICPTqRCn.description:
The stony bat breathes a puff of petrifying gas onto an adjacent creature, targeting a specific body part. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or be partially petrified for 1 minute, with an effect varying with the body part targeted.

  • Face The creature's face stiffens and a film of stone partially blocks its vision. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.
  • Hand One of the creature's hands is petrified. It cannot Release items from that hand or use the hand for fine manipulation. Attack rolls with weapons held in that hand take a –2 status penalty.
  • Leg A patch of the creature's leg becomes inflexible and heavy. It takes a –10 status penalty to its Speed. If all of the creature's legs become petrified in this way, the creature's Speed is reduced down to 5 feet. At the GM's discretion, a creature with movement that doesn't rely on legs, such as creatures that Fly with wings, don't take a penalty to these other Speeds.
bpzkvokQICPTqRCn.name: Petrify Body Part

hITWxw0rfE7Mw2zr.description: The stony bat specifically targets petrified body parts, which it can consume, unlike flesh. The stony bat's jaws deal an extra @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage against a creature that has been petrified, either partially or completely, and ignore the Hardness of petrified creatures.
hITWxw0rfE7Mw2zr.name: Stone Feast

sI3QMH0zN2o1CNCo.description: The stony bat breathes petrifying gas in a 15-foot cone, too thin to harm creatures in the area. However, it petrifies ambient moisture, raining down a cascade of tiny stones onto any creatures in the space directly below the cone. The falling rocks deal @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]). The stony bat can't use Petrify Vapor again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Petrify Vapor]]{1d4 rounds}
sI3QMH0zN2o1CNCo.name: Petrify Vapor

CKFDEB6XiCoXc9ie.description: The stony goat Leaps up to 12 feet vertically and 20 feet horizontally; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.
CKFDEB6XiCoXc9ie.name: Overhead Leap

JFdC8WSFlIpoumiM.description: A stony goat can trot across the steepest cliffs. It doesn't need to attempt Climb checks to scale inclines, and it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Climbing an incline. It ignores difficult terrain caused by rocks, rubble, and uneven ground made of earth and stone.
JFdC8WSFlIpoumiM.name: Cliff Climber

WM49TxgFCDnEGfN0.description:
Trigger The stony goat loses the petrified condition

Effect The stony goat's first instinct is to escape. It Strides with a +20 circumstance bonus to its Speed.
WM49TxgFCDnEGfN0.name: Stone Bolt

gtYvOmVkOoF5oQjc.description: The stony goat attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the nearest creature and then Strides with a +20-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.
gtYvOmVkOoF5oQjc.name: Shove and Run

ymqNbLM0VaieXXow.description:
Trigger The stony goat gains the frightened condition or takes more than 8 damage in a single hit

Effect The stony goat turns to stone in self-defense. It gains the petrified condition for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If the goat is damaged while it's petrified, it immediately heals by that amount by absorbing minerals from its cud, causing its cud to lose value equal to the amount of Hit Points restored (for instance, losing 5 gp worth of value to restore 5 Hit Points); if the goat's cud is reduced to 0 gp, it has the minerals fully drained from it, and the goat won't form more cud until it has eaten a sufficient quantity of rock and slept.
ymqNbLM0VaieXXow.name: Self-Petrify

BzxOo51mqHtteXxe.description:
Trigger A creature touches the storm snake or damages it with an unarmed melee attack or non-reach melee weapon

Effect The triggering enemy is shocked for @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:19|basic:true] save). On a failed save, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
BzxOo51mqHtteXxe.name: Static Shock

I7QrAlBGtdUJLHWm.description: The storm snake redirects the lightning it has absorbed from storms, dealing @Damage[2d10[electricity]] damage to a single target within 20 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save). On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn.
I7QrAlBGtdUJLHWm.name: Lightning Strike

onLE1fcaDs0SR79p.description: The storm snake gathers all static electricity in the area before releasing it in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] that deals @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage to all non-plant creatures (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19] save) and grants plant creatures 5 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute. Plant life in the area begins to grow significantly faster than the average for plants of their genus; in forests, fields, or otherwise floral locations, this immediately transforms the area into nonmagical difficult terrain. The storm snake can't use Static field again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Static field]]{1d4 rounds}.
onLE1fcaDs0SR79p.name: Static Field

BnRSgGcCa2yWLnk6.description: The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed. All creatures directly below the spaces it moves through must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or be exposed to sun's touch poison. The serpent cannot fly further than 60 feet above the target or the poison becomes too dispersed in the fall to take effect.
BnRSgGcCa2yWLnk6.name: Sun's Heat

HI5afO4uknNWUqlH.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is flying

Effect The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed, then crashes to the ground, releasing a wave of heat dealing @Damage[5d10[fire]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[type:burst|distance:60] and searing their eyes with the erupting glory of its scales. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round, and dazzled for 1 minute.
HI5afO4uknNWUqlH.name: Unleash the Sun

KVer6di68iaMUDTc.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The sunscale serpent makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.
KVer6di68iaMUDTc.name: Bonded Strike

Rj9yAmOBbp5iNU68.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds;

Stage 1 @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 round)
Rj9yAmOBbp5iNU68.name: Sun's Touch

f7ggMymNLWhho7xl.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 28, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.
f7ggMymNLWhho7xl.name: Bond with Mortal

Swordfish.description: Contrary to popular belief, the bill of the swordfish is not used for impaling its prey, but to stun or slash. Specialized organs help keep it warm in the coldest waters, increasing its already considerable speed and reflexes.

1tA3i1FWUctJmGlH.description:
Requirements The swordfish is in cold water

Trigger The swordfish rolls initiative

Effect The swordfish Seeks or Swims.
1tA3i1FWUctJmGlH.name: Warm Brain

InDTSGE7SMMdWecU.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The swordfish makes two bill Strikes against two adjacent targets, with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack rolls.
InDTSGE7SMMdWecU.name: Fast Sweep

Swordfish.name: Swordfish

S3o54Lnee9IO7n9L.description: The cave squirrel lets out a terrible scream. Non–cave squirrel creatures within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or take @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage. On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. The cave squirrel can't use Screaming Force again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Screaming Force]]{1d4 rounds}.
S3o54Lnee9IO7n9L.name: Screaming Force

Uw5Cs8JXh6arirCk.description: The cave squirrel dives underground in search of gems. The cave squirrel Burrows up to its Speed. It must end its movement back on the surface. During its burrow, it happens upon [[/r 1d4]] cheap gems (such as salt or quartz), which it stuffs in its cheeks, up to its maximum of 6.
Uw5Cs8JXh6arirCk.name: Forage for Gems

ZkT9jtUw3IqD4gOk.description: A cave squirrel isn't affected by difficult terrain from earth or stone.
ZkT9jtUw3IqD4gOk.name: Natural Speed

eb5bNipVYPMkjbDH.description: The cave squirrel can store up to six gems in its cheeks. It typically begins combat with all six, and it loses a gem each time it uses gem spit.
eb5bNipVYPMkjbDH.name: Studded Cheeks

owT2QG52E3VwrS7Z.description:
Trigger The cave squirrel rolls initiative or has taken damage before initiative

Effect The cave squirrel lets out an earpiercing shriek, alerting any other cave squirrels in the area to its plight. It uses Screaming Force.
owT2QG52E3VwrS7Z.name: Defensive Scream

sPTW134116xLKB5N.description: On a critical hit on a gem spit Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
sPTW134116xLKB5N.name: Concussive Gem

AqvYv5EgeNts4Nm8.description: As the tardigrade swarm is damaged, the bodies of those that enter a tun state make the ground treacherous. When the tardigrade swarm drops below 70 Hit Points, the space they occupy is considered difficult terrain.
AqvYv5EgeNts4Nm8.name: Tun Marbles

H3F0cDhkmIXQwrao.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail their save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increase their drained condition by one, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.
H3F0cDhkmIXQwrao.name: Stylets

IJhsgKvchGrIIKXn.description: A tardigrade swarm can't see anything beyond 30 feet.
IJhsgKvchGrIIKXn.name: Eyespots

Therizinosaurus.description: At first glance, the therizinosaurus, with its rotund, feathered body and bird-like beak, strikes many observers as almost comical. This impression tends to quickly fade at the sight of the creature's claws, six wicked, scythelike blades capable of disemboweling a foe with a single well-placed slash. Despite their intimidating appearance, these enormous claws are used primarily to separate tasty leaves and branches from the tops of the tall trees upon which the therizinosaurus feeds. Nonetheless, travelers through a therizinosaurus's territory are wisely advised to give the creature a wide berth, less they wind up on the wrong end of its notoriously foul temper.

FZbkZYEUVtBk8Mcx.description: The therizinosaurus makes two claw Strikes against different targets. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but do not increase the penalty until it has made both attacks.
FZbkZYEUVtBk8Mcx.name: Swiping Claws

fmnvGP7coWwgi0Pv.description: The therizinosaurus stomps about, dealing @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save) to each adjacent creature. Large or smaller creatures who fail their save are also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
fmnvGP7coWwgi0Pv.name: Stomp Pests

zSVB7lKCzd3EnT8E.description: Whenever the therizinosaurus successfully Strikes a Large or smaller creature with its claw, it pulls that creature 5 feet toward it (10 feet on a critical hit).
zSVB7lKCzd3EnT8E.name: Winnowing Claws

Therizinosaurus.name: Therizinosaurus

Thruneosaurus Rex.description: The unholy terror known as the thruneosaurus rex is not a natural beast. They were created by Chelaxian diabolists who sought to combine the ferocity of dinosaurs with the power of Hell, infusing a clutch of tyrannosaurus rex eggs from Mediogalti Island with devil ichor and naming the monstrous hatchlings after their patrons. Although few records and fewer survivors tell exactly how the experiment went awry, the experimental subjects escaped, and their descendants are now most often sighted in the Whisperwood in eastern Cheliax.

9JFkjEnfVFnAuNdf.description:
Trigger The thruneosaurus takes damage from a holy effect;

Effect The thruneosaurus teleports to an open space within 60 feet it can see, along with any creatures it has swallowed whole.
9JFkjEnfVFnAuNdf.name: Instinctive Teleportation

DWRlaBfxXrVIyZMy.description:
The thruneosaurus channels sulfurous hellfire in one of three ways. The thruneosaurus chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice in two consecutive rounds.

  • Blistering Sun (divine, fire, unholy) The thruneosaurus ignites an orb of hellfire between its horns that radiates heat in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[2d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
  • Choking Fumes (divine, poison, unholy) The thruneosaurus exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of sulfurous smoke that deals @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:38|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail their saves are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
  • Fiery Beam (divine, fire, unholy) A @Template[type:line|distance:120] of hellish flame erupts from the thruneosaurus's eyes, dealing @Damage[6d10[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save).
DWRlaBfxXrVIyZMy.name: Hellfire Blast

Thruneosaurus Rex.name: Thruneosaurus Rex

Titanosaur.description: Titanosaurs are some of the largest land animals ever to walk the surface of Golarion, massive sauropods that can reach over 100 feet in length and weigh more than 80 tons. While typically content to focus on consuming vast quantities of vegetation and ignore the presence of smaller creatures, titanosaurs that feel threatened can unleash destruction rivaling natural disasters.

15vn04Bm1yucrFJI.description: The titanosaur lashes its tail in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save). The momentum of the titanosaur's swing then makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of its next turn.
15vn04Bm1yucrFJI.name: Sweeping Tail

A2j8VSHNeAkdCLDx.description:
90 feet. Creatures of Huge size or smaller that enter the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the titanosaur's Majestic Presence for 1 hour. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the titanosaur for 1 round.

Failure The creature is fascinated for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for 1 minute.
A2j8VSHNeAkdCLDx.name: Majestic Presence

n2Pm6UWT3TK2ss5u.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The titanosaur rears up on its hind legs before slamming its forelegs back on the ground with a thunderous crash, creating a localized tremor with the effects of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.x7SPrsRxGb2Vy2nu]{Earthquake} spell centered on itself, though the effect is non-magical. Fissures do not form under the titanosaur.
n2Pm6UWT3TK2ss5u.name: Seismic Slam

Titanosaur.name: Titanosaur

Troodon.description: Troodons stand roughly 3 feet tall and twice as long, with slender necks and large, inquisitive eyes. Although they don't fully understand language, troodons have a remarkable talent for speech mimicry.

169mTVhwXosKc4fm.description: The troodon Strides and makes a claw Strike at any point during that movement.
169mTVhwXosKc4fm.name: Running Attack

n8oCyZ449dRTuGuc.description: The troodon repeats up to twelve words it heard in the last week. If it succeeds at a Deception check against the listeners' Perception DC, the sound is indistinguishable from the original. The troodon can't duplicate voice-based abilities or spells, although it can mimic the verbal sounds of spellcasting.
n8oCyZ449dRTuGuc.name: Mimicry

Troodon.name: Troodon

8R6BDkL9QLaWq6eP.description: The tyrafdir breathes out a noxious mist from all of its mouths, spreading in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] that deals 4d10 poison damage to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true] save). Any creature that fails its save must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save or gain weakness to mental 10 and a –1 status penalty to Will saves for 24 hours. The tyrafdir can't use Noxious Exhalation again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Noxious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.
8R6BDkL9QLaWq6eP.name: Noxious Exhalation

DMOJ4yLThF6IR3o3.description:
HP(head) 30, deceptive regrowth;

Immunities area damage;

Weakness cold iron 10, slashing 10
DMOJ4yLThF6IR3o3.name: Tyrafdir Heads

IQVIxxRDsn8zGCTb.description: A tyrafdir is cunning, if unintelligent, using illusions of regrown heads to confuse and harry opponents. When a tyrafdir fails, but does not critically fail, its Fortitude save to regrow a head, a phantasm materializes to mimic the regrowth. This creates two deceptive heads that function differently than real heads. The tyrafdir gains a deceptive jaws Strike as long as it has at least one deceptive head. Any creature that attacks a deceptive head or uses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve the illusion (@Check[type:will|dc:27] save).
IQVIxxRDsn8zGCTb.name: Deceptive Heads

TdIuHFKFunRMvQfU.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.
TdIuHFKFunRMvQfU.name: Reactive Heads

ePJWvJFe4lMaXPXQ.description: A tyrafdir ordinarily has six heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the tyrafdir's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A tyrafdir can regrow a severed head using Hydra Regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any fire damage or is dealt by a cold-iron weapon, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all six heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.
ePJWvJFe4lMaXPXQ.name: Deceptive Regrowth

volbbhoYsX3VRgOG.description:
On a failure the tyrafdir grows two illusory heads.

The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 × the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.
volbbhoYsX3VRgOG.name: Hydra Regeneration

T2BEVw72KQFJGSNY.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(2d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save).
T2BEVw72KQFJGSNY.name: Swarming Bites

cuy3IgZ93Vnm8vNh.description:
Trigger The vibrant pup swarm is critically hit by a Strike;

Effect The worker pups become insensitive to pain and leap to the front. The swarm gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.
cuy3IgZ93Vnm8vNh.name: Feel No Pain

lezQSO0htwcgHmIZ.description: 10 feet. Other creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}. The aura automatically activates when the swarm is in bright light and deactivates in dim light or darkness.
lezQSO0htwcgHmIZ.name: Reflective Skin

q3FDvNCaWX2X7VEI.description:
Requirements The vibrant pup swarm is in bright light

Effect The swarm simultaneously turns to focus the light in an arcing beam, dealing @Damage[(6d12)[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true]). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). The swarm can't use Focused Reflection again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Focused Reflection]]{1d4 rounds}.
q3FDvNCaWX2X7VEI.name: Focused Reflection

452LdrpT5OCYCH0j.description:
Trigger An opponent within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird makes a counteract check against the triggering spell ([[/r 1d20+14 #Counteract]]{+14} counteract modifier).
452LdrpT5OCYCH0j.name: Counter-Melody

iQyVAyqr5ERKcsoM.description:
Effect The virtuosic lyrebird sings a subtle trill that others can use to embellish their magic. The next virtuosic lyrebird to Cast a Spell within 60 feet of the first lyrebird that used Arcane Harmony chooses one of the following two benefits, after which the Arcane Harmony ends.

  • The spell gains a +2 status bonus to damage per spell rank.
  • One target of the spell takes a –2 status penalty to saves against the spell.
iQyVAyqr5ERKcsoM.name: Arcane Harmony

t2isDsAZlZxwt4lc.description: The virtuosic lyrebird's exquisite vocal control lets it cast spells purely through its song. While it must be able to vocalize to Cast a Spell, it doesn't need to gesture, removing the manipulate trait from any spell that it casts. If it Casts a Spell with the linguistic trait (usually with its Spell Mimicry), it can Cast that Spell in Common, even though the bird doesn't truly understand the language.
t2isDsAZlZxwt4lc.name: Spellsong Casting

zaQeFovenkFyl9Mp.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements A creature Casts a Spell of 3rd rank or lower since the end of the virtuosic lyrebird' s last turn, and the virtuosic lyrebird heard the incantation for the spell;

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird learns the spell enough to mimic and cast it this turn, using as many actions as the original spell took.
zaQeFovenkFyl9Mp.name: Spell Mimicry

Warden of Caverns and Burrows.description:
The Connected Depths

As much as air currents flow through the skies, and the oceans connect the waters of world, the caverns and depths connect to each other as well, via several means. Underground flows of lava create tunnels and passages. Water's erosion also forms cave systems out of the stone.

1R03lSgMof62gZ9x.description: The depths call to the warden, especially as they move through the air. When they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, they can use any unused movement from the Long Jump to Burrow. Additionally, the warden can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, they move at their full burrow Speed.
1R03lSgMof62gZ9x.name: Called to Depths

9y73RR8Oukdu0LR2.description:
Requirements The warden has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The warden attempts to wedge a creature they have grabbed in their mandibles within a crack in the earth that opens beneath them. The warden attempts an Athletics check against the grabbed creature's Reflex DC. If they succeed, they bury the creature in the ground. The creature takes @Damage[10d10[bludgeoning]] damage. It is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating until it Escapes (DC 42). If the creature is still buried at the end of its turn, it takes @Damage[5d10[bludgeoning]] damage.
9y73RR8Oukdu0LR2.name: Bury Beneath Stone

DbnyJTJcNZglKgOK.description: The Warden of Caverns and Burrows clings to surfaces with their segmented feet. They do not need to use a hand to hold on to walls or ceilings.
DbnyJTJcNZglKgOK.name: Wall Cling

SMbxooGFfHJk1iAh.description: The warden screeches with a resonant call that tears apart earth and stone. They create a 10-foot-square, 50-foot-deep pit in earthen material or stone within 60 feet.
SMbxooGFfHJk1iAh.name: Vibratory Excavation

tCBjmjZJjM3CRcp6.description: Rapidly cooling obsidian clings to the target's body and stiffens around their limbs. The target must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:42] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (DC 42). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain immobilized.
tCBjmjZJjM3CRcp6.name: Obsidian Cage

twmWdzuIfOtysw73.description: The warden draws out a stream of lava, then jumps off the solidifying mass as it cools. The warden Leaps up to twice their Speed. When they land, the force of the impact deals @Damage[6d12[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true] save. On a critical failure, the creature is also pushed 10 feet away from the warden.
twmWdzuIfOtysw73.name: Erupting Jump

xZpqgaOSfAIieweF.description:
Trigger The warden is targeted with an attack

Effect The warden issues a spray of magma as they jump away from danger. This spray deals @Damage[6d12[fire]] damage to all adjacent creatures (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save). They then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} or Step away, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.
xZpqgaOSfAIieweF.name: Magmatic Reflex

Warden of Caverns and Burrows.name: Warden of Caverns and Burrows

4hxuRQeozI2YcGao.description:
Trigger An enemy within 60 feet targets the warden with an attack, spell, or other ability

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:45] save. If it fails, the warden redirects the ability to target a different creature in range with a burst of mental laughter; this has no effect if there are no other eligible targets. The triggering creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours unless it critically failed.
4hxuRQeozI2YcGao.name: Wild Trickery

83BZB1SWTBDiRPsE.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The warden creates an area of peaceful calm. This is identical to a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} depicting a peaceful meadow or forest, except the area is a @Template[type:burst|distance:200].

While within the area of an Idyllic Panorama, the warden has significant control over the senses of creatures within the area and can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPXzPl7YbMEIGWfi]{Mislead} and 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} at will.
83BZB1SWTBDiRPsE.name: Idyllic Panorama

CSU1nwsLk8jcgev0.description: The Warden of Forests and Meadows ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.
CSU1nwsLk8jcgev0.name: Forest Passage

dkMORZZnD9bglG5r.description: The warden Strides up to his Speed, Leaps up to his Speed, or casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}; at the end of that movement, the warden Strikes. If the warden began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, he remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.
dkMORZZnD9bglG5r.name: Magical Pounce

mRMBYx28OBTaqHDC.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

The warden transforms his size to Tiny, Small, Medium, or Huge (changing his reach to 0 feet for Tiny, 5 feet for Medium or Large, and 10 feet for Huge). The warden retains his shape but can change his color to any seasonal array.

q2Ut12vsCILmClE8.description: The warden grants a boon to a willing creature he can see other than himself, requesting that the creature promise to use the granted power to destroy or undermine the creations of civilization. The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +5 status bonus to damage against constructs, objects, and structures constructed by humanoids. It also gains a +2 status bonus to Stealth checks against humanoids. The warden can have only one wager granted at a time. The wager ends if the target is captured or dies.
q2Ut12vsCILmClE8.name: Fox's Wager

Warden of Oceans and Rivers.description:
A Vengeful Present

In past eras, the Warden of Oceans and Rivers was once connected to the world of landed creatures and deeply involved in their channels of commerce. Now the descendants of these creatures are unable to rely on the bounty of the sea and feel that they must take what they can to survive. Fishing folk must be swift and deliberate now that the oceans and rivers zealously protect their goods. It is for this reason not all agree with the new warden's tactics… and some wish to see the old ways restored.

1YzPEJHi0V8SIf7l.description: All creatures in the warden's bioluminescent maelstrom take @Damage[10d6[cold]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:45|basic:true] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.
1YzPEJHi0V8SIf7l.name: Arctic Embrace

GzGiL0g8PtgRHP2r.description:
Creatures struck by one of the warden's tentacles gain cold weakness 10 and take a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HzPg4iUmO3F6tbK6]{Effect: Grasp of the Deep}
GzGiL0g8PtgRHP2r.name: Grasp of the Deep

YuQVBiDWQJ7MDC5X.description: The warden attacks with their tentacles six times.
YuQVBiDWQJ7MDC5X.name: What Lurks Beneath

avd6lE7DXF8bpEZv.description: The warden creates three lines of rushing water, each 10 feet wide and 120 feet long. Creatures in the area take @Damage[18d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:45|basic:true] save). The warden can either push or pull, and all creatures that fail this save move up to 40 feet in the direction chosen. The warden can't use I Am The Tide again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge I Am The Tide]]{1d4 rounds}.
avd6lE7DXF8bpEZv.name: I Am The Tide

i4hk1NJdv96uNYdo.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The warden attracts organisms that extend their influence. The area of bioluminescent maelstrom and the reach of their tentacle Strike increase by 10 feet for 1 minute, to a maximum of an additional 30 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Rs64h4dLbYVWvFJe]{Effect: All Are One}
i4hk1NJdv96uNYdo.name: All Are One

n7xlpAEzqjncArlj.description:
30 feet @Check[type:will|dc:45]

The warden's wrath conjures a dazzling storm around them that makes the area difficult terrain. Creatures that enter the storm must attempt a Will save. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the luring visuals for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, and for the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to move as close to the warden as possible.

Critical Failure The creature is dazzled for as long as it remains in the aura. Whenever the creature begins its turn within the aura, the creature must use the first action of its turn to move as close to the warden as possible. It can attempt a new save at the end of its turn, ending this effect on a success.
n7xlpAEzqjncArlj.name: Bioluminescent Maelstrom

Warden of Oceans and Rivers.name: Warden of Oceans and Rivers

Warden of Peaks and Skies.description:
Warden's Blessing

Legend says that the Warden of Peaks and Sky invites those who particularly earn their favor into their home, a nest within a hollow peak deep in the Kodar Mountains. There, the guest is treated to a grand feast, after which the warden offers to turn them into a thunderbird so they might enjoy the sky for the rest of their days, though they are not offended if anyone demurs.

4S0TKyHtVQ0rTagU.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair the warden's vision; she ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.
4S0TKyHtVQ0rTagU.name: Stormsight

OSyHzaEUEnuN2yN4.description: The warden flies 240 feet upward in a straight line. As she does so, the ground in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] from her starting point rises into a 120-foot-high rocky pillar topped with a mountainous peak that becomes greater difficult terrain. All other creatures in that burst must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} by the sudden altitude shift. The warden then flies straight downward to the center of the pillar's peak, driving her horns into the stone. As she lands, the newly formed mountains tremble. All other creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:42] save or plummet off the peaks, falling 120 feet and landing in the nearest square outside the area. The pillar is permanent.
OSyHzaEUEnuN2yN4.name: Orogenesis Dive

m31f7gFeLKTcuV5I.description: The warden breathes, creating a storm of ice crystals. All creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] take @Damage[4d8[cold]] damage and @Damage[4d8[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by ice. The warden then can't use Crystal Exhalation for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
m31f7gFeLKTcuV5I.name: Crystal Exhalation

qOrbqjETiPFlD3bW.description:
The warden trills a cheerful birdsong, granting a boon to all allies within 60 feet and evoking the freedom of flight. For the next minute, affected allies gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}, a fly speed of 60 feet, and treat creatures on the ground as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} when they are airborne.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dZDpfgU63rXbBHpe]{Effect: Song of the Skies}
qOrbqjETiPFlD3bW.name: Song of the Skies

vBzwVdv5SH12bUnj.description:
Trigger The warden Flies

Effect s The warden's flapping wings generate powerful gusts that blow smaller creatures off course. A @Template[type:emanation|distance:60], centered on the warden, fills with lightning-pierced winds until the beginning of the warden's next turn. Creatures must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:42] save to take any move action within the winds; flying creatures use the outcome one degree of success worse than what they roll. Creatures who critically fail are blown 30 feet away from the warden, knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and take @Damage[4d6[electricity]] damage.
vBzwVdv5SH12bUnj.name: Tempest Downdrafts

Warden of Peaks and Skies.name: Warden of Peaks and Skies

Daweg1i0kaXSnpof.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its antlers by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
Daweg1i0kaXSnpof.name: Moon Frenzy

PBbZheMzP1YRLCYf.description: A weremoose can communicate with deer, including moose
PBbZheMzP1YRLCYf.name: Deer Empathy

VVdmEh4xA1SlQGBa.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
VVdmEh4xA1SlQGBa.name: Curse of the Weremoose

eAZIsoNkpFDUXhr2.description: The weremoose treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme.
eAZIsoNkpFDUXhr2.name: Cold Adaptation

iztAc9yj0XX0NQi0.description:
Medium human with fist +11 for 1d4+6 bludgeoning,

or

Large moose with antler and hoof +11 for 1d8+6 bludgeoning.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

w6LNTDUzUbVxW3Rj.description: The weremoose Strides twice and then makes an antler Strike. A Medium or smaller creature damaged by this attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
w6LNTDUzUbVxW3Rj.name: Thundering Charge

2EsiHAMS4PDQklhS.description: The wereshark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
2EsiHAMS4PDQklhS.name: Blood Scent

IR2MrKsw9GROfUZ6.description:
Medium human with fist +14 for 1d4+7 bludgeoning,

or Large shark with jaws +14 for 1d12+7 piercing, no land Speed, and swim Speed 40 feet.

The wereshark doesn't have the amphibious trait in human or shark form and has the aquatic trait in shark form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

mq4nQCSaqX6TDnvU.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
mq4nQCSaqX6TDnvU.name: Curse of the Wereshark

sSN3mmNLTMy2tN16.description:
Requirements The wereshark critically hit with a trident Strike on their most recent action this turn

Effect The wereshark digs their trident deep within their target, skewering it before taking a massive bite. The target of the Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 18) and takes @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage, and the wereshark attempts a jaws Strike against it. The wereshark can't use their trident while they have a creature grabbed with it, but they can pull the trident free with a single action that has the manipulate trait.
sSN3mmNLTMy2tN16.name: Fish Fork
